metadata.Title: CVE-2019-0211 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - high.
metadata.Description:
In Apache HTTP Server 2.4 releases 2.4.17 to 2.4.38, with MPM event, worker or prefork, code executing in less-privileged child processes or threads (including scripts executed by an in-process scripting interpreter) could execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the parent process (usually root) by manipulating the scoreboard. Non-Unix systems are not affected.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-0211` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

apache2 - 2.4.18-2ubuntu3.10
apache2-bin - 2.4.18-2ubuntu3.10
apache2-data - 2.4.18-2ubuntu3.10
apache2-suexec-custom - 2.4.18-2ubuntu3.10
apache2-suexec-pristine - 2.4.18-2ubuntu3.10
apache2-utils - 2.4.18-2ubuntu3.10
No subscription required

criterions.comment: apache2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.4.18-2ubuntu3.10').
